com.github.essobedo.appma.core

Interface ApplicationManager


  • public interface ApplicationManager
    The facade allowing the managed applications to interact with the application manager.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Nicolas Filotto (nicolas.filotto@gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Task<String> checkForUpdate()
      Gives the task allowing to check if there is a new version of the application.
      javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
      Gives the current Stage.
      void onExit()
      Callback allowing to notify the application manager that an application exit has been requested.
      void setOnCloseRequestPredicate(Predicate<Void> predicate)
      Provides the predicate to test in order to known whether the application can exit or not.
      Future<Void> upgrade()
      Triggers an upgrade of the application.

    • Method Detail

      • getStage

        javafx.stage.Stage getStage()
        Gives the current Stage.
        Returns:
        The current Stage in case of a Java FX application, null otherwise.

      • checkForUpdate

        Task<String> checkForUpdate()
                     throws ApplicationException
        Gives the task allowing to check if there is a new version of the application.
        Returns:
        The task allowing to check for a new version.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - in case the task could not be created.

      • upgrade

        Future<Void> upgrade()
        Triggers an upgrade of the application. The upgrade will be down asynchronously by the application manager.
        Returns:
        The Future representing the upgrade task.

      • onExit

        void onExit()
        Callback allowing to notify the application manager that an application exit has been requested.

      • setOnCloseRequestPredicate

        void setOnCloseRequestPredicate(Predicate<Void> predicate)
        Provides the predicate to test in order to known whether the application can exit or not. If Predicate.test(Object) return true, the application will be allowed to exit, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        predicate - The predicate to test.
